classitems.name: recordSet
classitems.description: This datasource's associated recordset

classitems.name: responseType
classitems.description: The expected response type ('xml', 'jsarray', 'json', 'text')

classitems.name: responseSchema
classitems.description:
The schema by which to parse the response data. May be:

DataSource.responseType.JSARRAY schema
A JSARRAY response type assumes the following response shape:

//All records are listed as an array
[
    ['value1', 'value2', 'value3'], //one record
    ['another1', 'another2', 'another3'] //another record
]

DataSource.responseType.TEXT schema
This schema essentially splits the string and then acts as if it where a DataSource.responseType.JSARRAY.
Must define a fieldDelim property. Example (comma separated value):

responseSchema: {
    fieldDelim: ","
    fields: ["firstField", "secondField"]
}

DataSource.responseType.JSON schema
Example:

responseSchema = {
    resultList : "Response.Results", // String pointer to result data
    // Field order doesn't matter and not all data is required to have a field
    fields : [
        { key: "id" }, // simple location
        { key: "obj" }
    ]
}

DataSource.responseType.XML schema
Example:

responseSchema: {
    resultNode: "rootNode", // every result field will be looked for between this node's children
    fields: [
        { key: "keyName", node: "nodeName" }, // in this case, the value of the field will be the node's value
       { key: "otherKey", node: "otherNode", attr: "type" }, // in this other case, the field value will be the "type" attribute
        { key: "aNumber", node: "someNode", parser: "parseFloat" } // this value will be parsed as a Float
    ]
}

classitems.description:
Copyright  2011 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved 
Code licensed under the BSD License
http://yuilibrary.com/license/

Returns a copy of the specified string with special HTML characters escaped. The following characters will be converted to their corresponding character entities: & < > " ' / ` This implementation is based on the [OWASP HTML escaping recommendations][1]. In addition to the characters in the OWASP recommendations, we also escape the ` character, since IE interprets it as an attribute delimiter. If _string_ is not already a string, it will be coerced to a string. [1]: http://www.owasp.org/index.php/XSS_(Cross_Site_Scripting)_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet
classitems.name: html

params.name: string
params.description: String to escape.

classitems.description:
Returns a copy of the specified string with special regular expression
characters escaped, allowing the string to be used safely inside a regex.
The following characters, and all whitespace characters, are escaped:

    - # $ ^ * ( ) + [ ] { } | \ , . ?

If _string_ is not already a string, it will be coerced to a string.
classitems.name: regex

params.name: string
params.description: String to escape.

classitems.description: Regex replacer for HTML escaping.
classitems.name: _htmlReplacer

params.description: Matched character (must exist in HTML_CHARS).
